newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina to send single tax bill to Congress.
newsitem.headline: Argentina to send single tax bill to Congress.

text.p: The Argentine governemnt will send a law to Congress offering small businesses the option of reducing paperwork by paying a single tax, Economy Ministry officials said Wednesday.
The government will send the bill to Congress in two weeks and hopes the new simplified system will attract 200,000-300,000 firms and reduce tax evasion, they said.

Businesses with yearly revenues of less than $75,000 will be able to pay the single tax, replacing current levies made separately on profits, value-added, and payrolls, according to a draft of the bill obtained by Reuters.
